June 2021 Edition

Welcome to the Latest Edition of 
The Justia Insider

We are celebrating our first newsletter anniversary! We are pleased to announce the first anniversary of The Justia Insider. Our newsletter has become an incredible instrument to share information and projects from all the company teams. We have also been able to highlight and acknowledge the contributions of our excellent colleagues from Mexico and the United States. As we celebrate our newsletter's first anniversary, we are delighted to report that we continue succeeding as a company with everybody's work and dedication. On behalf of our Editorial Team, we would like to thank everyone.

Milestones & Accomplishments

Let’s Find Out What’s Been Achieved So Far by Our Teams at Justia

Main Portal Updates: Our team updated our 50-state surveys on issues specific to the COVID-19 pandemic, such as state reopening plans, eviction and foreclosure protections, court operations, travel restrictions, and mask mandates. We also added snippets of key facts, issues, and definitions to our Divorce, Child Custody, Family Law, and Criminal Law centers.

Justia Lawyer Directory: Our team added pages to the JLD on considerations for hiring a lawyer in 19 different practice areas.

Legal News Blog: We continued adding two blog posts per week to our Legal News blog.

NEW TEAM MEMBERS

Getting to Know the New Talent at Justia

Gerardo Rodriguez

IT Team

I am a tech enthusiast, an Apple fan, and the father of a dog and a cat. I like to spend time with friends and family, go hiking with my dog, practice adventure sports, listen to music, read about tech news and Buddhism, and try Italian and Oriental food. I consider myself a cheerful and optimistic person with both strengths and weaknesses. One of the greatest virtues of life is helping people around you and always doing the right thing.

Ivan Bonilla

Engineering Team

I'm a seasoned software developer who is always eager to learn new technologies. I've been married for more than 16 years, and I'm a proud father of four children. I'm excited to be part of the Justia Mexico team, and I'm looking forward to participating in up-and-coming and exciting projects in the future.

UPCOMING HOLIDAYS

Dates to Remember

Father's Day (Mexico & U.S.) - June 20th

While it is not a public holiday, people in Mexico and the U.S. annually celebrate Father’s Day on the third Sunday of June. It is an observance to honor fathers and male parental figures in both countries. It is also an opportunity to express your love,

appreciation, and gratitude. On this day, people thank all those men who set solid examples and guide us throughout our lives.

Did You Know?

Stacy Attended the 2021 President's Innovation Challenge Virtual Awards Ceremony

On May 5th, Stacy participated in the 2021 President's Innovation Challenge Virtual Awards Ceremony hosted by Harvard Innovation Labs. The online event helped discover the Harvard ventures actively changing our world for the better.

Reminders

Reminder About Using Your PTOThis is a friendly reminder to encourage everyone to take some time off (PTO). It is an opportunity to take a step back, focus on your loved ones, and avoid work-related stress and burnout. Our HR

department suggests taking advantage of this benefit. Keep in mind that taking one or a couple of days off can make a huge difference. PTO is good for your health!

JUSTIA EMPLOYEE SPOTLIGHT

Justia's Father’s Day Tribute

WELLNESS

The Benefits of Gardening

Believe it or not, in addition to reaping beautiful flowers and nutritious harvests for your table, gardening can do wonders for your well-being to make it through these tough times. Roll up your sleeves, start digging, planting, and weeding as a healthy alternative to cope with this "new normal." Find below a list of several of these benefits:

● Gardening burns a lot of calories and can lower your blood pressure.

● Spending time outside is good for your bones.

● Growing your own food can help you eat healthier.

● Gardening can relieve stress.

● Gardening can make you happier.

REVIEWS & RECOMMENDATIONS

Alien Worlds

Available on Netflix

Are you one of those people who's always thinking about life in outer space? Do you like animals? Do you appreciate good gaming graphics? If so, then you should watch this four-part sci-fi nature docufiction miniseries. For me, the best thing about the series is the thinking process behind it, how the creators figured out how physics and each planet's environment can impact the survival skills of living creatures. From forever-flying animals to parasitic deathly fungi, I think it is fascinating how the creators replicated Earth-like life into outer space planets.

- Miguel Lopez

Collaborators: Miguel Berlanga, Donovan Coronado, Haydee Garcia, Alejandra Medina, Lauren Moskie, Rene Peralta, and Jose Ramos
